newsitem.title: USA: IBM to unveil speech software - NYTimes.
newsitem.headline: IBM to unveil speech software - NYTimes.

text.p: International Business Machines Corp plans to announce its latest speech-recognition software on Thursday, the New York Times reported.
The software, currently designed for radiologists who dictate repetitive reports, recognises about 25,000 English words, the article said.
It achieves 95-percent accuracy upon first use, but the accuracy improves once the software is "trained" to the user's specific voice.
The software runs on a personal computer using Microsoft Corp's Windows NT operating system and a 200-megahertz Pentium processor made by Intel Corp, the Times said.
The system -- including hardware and software -- will sell for $12,000 to $15,000 per unit, the article said.
